name: C.V. Raman

trait_summary.Persistence: Built his own laboratory with minimal resources
trait_summary.Creativity: Discovered the Raman Effect through novel light scattering experiments
trait_summary.Social Impact: First Asian Nobel laureate in sciences, inspired generations

personality_summary: A fiercely independent experimentalist who overcame resource scarcity through creative instrument-building. Driven by national pride and desire to prove Indian science could lead globally.
key_moments: Built spectrograph from salvaged parts
Rejected prestigious Western positions to stay in India
Founded Indian Academy of Sciences

name: Srinivasa Ramanujan

trait_summary.Intuition: Developed theorems through pure intuition and dreams
trait_summary.Persistence: Continued mathematical work despite poverty and illness
trait_summary.Resilience: Overcame social barriers and health challenges

personality_summary: An intensely intuitive mathematician who saw patterns others couldn't perceive. Worked in isolation with minimal formal training, yet produced groundbreaking results that challenged mathematical orthodoxy.
key_moments: Self-taught advanced mathematics from a single book
Sent letter to G.H. Hardy that changed mathematical history
Continued work from hospital bed during final illness

name: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

trait_summary.Social Impact: Made space technology accessible, became People's President
trait_summary.Persistence: Led India's missile program despite initial failures
trait_summary.Resilience: Rose from humble beginnings to national leadership

personality_summary: A mission-driven engineer who combined technical excellence with deep social consciousness. Believed science should serve humanity and spent his life mentoring youth and building institutions.
key_moments: Led SLV-3 project after initial failure
Developed India's missile program under sanctions
Used presidency to inspire millions of students

name: Homi J. Bhabha

trait_summary.Logic: Systematic approach to building India's nuclear program
trait_summary.Risk-Taking: Advocated for nuclear energy when it was controversial
trait_summary.Collaboration: Founded TIFR and built scientific institutions

personality_summary: A strategic thinker who saw science as key to national sovereignty. Combined theoretical brilliance with institution-building prowess, creating the foundation for India's nuclear and space programs.
key_moments: Founded Tata Institute of Fundamental Research
Architected India's three-stage nuclear program
Organized first International Conference on Peaceful Uses of Atomic Energy

name: Vikram Sarabhai

trait_summary.Social Impact: Founded ISRO with focus on societal applications
trait_summary.Creativity: Envisioned space tech for rural development
trait_summary.Logic: Systematic planning of India's space program

personality_summary: A Renaissance scientist who believed technology should serve society's poorest. Combined cosmic ambitions with grounded social consciousness, making space research relevant to Indian villages.
key_moments: Founded Physical Research Laboratory at age 28
Established Indian space program with focus on education and communication
Created satellite instructional TV experiment for rural education

name: Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar

trait_summary.Logic: Rigorous mathematical approach to stellar evolution
trait_summary.Resilience: Continued work despite criticism from Eddington

personality_summary: A theoretical purist who pursued mathematical beauty and physical truth with unwavering dedication. Willing to challenge established authorities when logic demanded it.
key_moments: Calculated stellar mass limit during ship voyage to Cambridge
Stood firm against Eddington's public criticism
Won Nobel Prize 53 years after initial discovery

name: Salim Ali

trait_summary.Persistence: Conducted field surveys across India for decades
trait_summary.Social Impact: Made ornithology accessible through popular writing

personality_summary: A patient observer who found meaning in India's natural heritage. Believed conservation required public engagement and spent his life documenting and popularizing bird science.
key_moments: Conducted Systematic Survey of Indian birds across all habitats
Prevented Silent Valley hydroelectric project to save biodiversity
Published 'Book of Indian Birds' that inspired millions

name: Har Gobind Khorana

trait_summary.Logic: Methodical approach to deciphering genetic code

personality_summary: A meticulous experimentalist who combined chemical precision with biological insight. Believed in systematic exploration and collaborative science.
key_moments: Deciphered how RNA codons specify amino acids
Constructed first synthetic gene
Shared Nobel Prize for interpretation of genetic code

name: Tessy Thomas

trait_summary.Resilience: Overcame gender barriers in defense research
trait_summary.Persistence: Led Agni-V missile project through challenges
trait_summary.Logic: Systematic approach to ballistic missile design
trait_summary.Risk-Taking: Took on India's most ambitious missile program

personality_summary: A determined engineer who broke barriers to lead India's strategic missile program. Combines technical excellence with quiet perseverance.
key_moments: Became first woman scientist to head missile project
Successfully led Agni-IV and Agni-V missile development
Known as 'Missile Woman of India'

name: Yellapragada Subbarow

trait_summary.Persistence: Continued research despite lack of recognition
trait_summary.Social Impact: Work saved millions through antibiotics and cancer drugs

personality_summary: An unsung hero who prioritized impact over recognition. His biochemical discoveries transformed medicine, yet he remained largely unknown during his lifetime.
key_moments: Developed method to synthesize folic acid
Contributed to discovery of methotrexate for cancer
Work led to tetracycline antibiotics

name: M.S. Swaminathan

trait_summary.Social Impact: Led Green Revolution that saved millions from famine
trait_summary.Collaboration: Worked with farmers, policymakers, and scientists
trait_summary.Logic: Scientific breeding programs for Indian conditions

personality_summary: A mission-driven scientist who saw agriculture as both science and social justice. Believed technology should empower farmers and ensure food security.
key_moments: Introduced high-yielding wheat varieties to India
Prevented predicted famine in 1960s-70s
Advocated for sustainable agriculture and farmer rights

name: Jagadish Chandra Bose

trait_summary.Creativity: Pioneered radio waves and plant physiology
trait_summary.Risk-Taking: Pursued unconventional ideas about plant consciousness
trait_summary.Persistence: Built instruments and conducted experiments with limited funding
trait_summary.Social Impact: Refused to patent inventions for commercial gain

personality_summary: A polymath who refused to be bound by disciplinary boundaries. Believed in open science and that nature held unified principles across physics and biology.
key_moments: Demonstrated wireless communication before Marconi
Invented crescograph to measure plant response
Founded Bose Institute for interdisciplinary research
